identificationModule.briefTitle: Role of Light Tracking Intervention in Children With Spastic Hemiplegia
identificationModule.officialTitle: EFFICACY OF VISUAL LIGHT TRACKING ON CHILDREN WITH SPASTIC HEMIPLEGIA

responsibleParty.investigatorFullName: MAHMOUD AHMED GOUDA ALI ABDELAZIZ ABDELMONEIM

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The study aims to investigate the effect of visual light tracking on gait, selective motor control and sensory processing in children with spastic hemiplegic cerebral palsy.

interventions.name: Visual Light Tracking
interventions.description: visual light tracking program consists of 10 tasks every task lasts for 6 minutes and may be repeated for the child especially in the first sessions to give him trials to him/her to understand the exercise.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Effect of Visual light tracking intervention on quality of walking, selective motor control and sensory processing of the study group compared to control group with different intervention.
primaryOutcomes.description:
The quality of walking as step length will be assessed using Kinovea software. Selective motor control will be assessed using Selective Control Assessment of the Lower Extremity (points).

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Age ranged from (4-7 years).
* They will be able to walk independently.
* They will have intact auditory pathways.
* They will have intact visual pathways.
* They will have a mild degree of spasticity graded from 1 to 1+ according to the modified Ashworth scale
* They will be mentally stable.

Exclusion Criteria:

* Any other neuromuscular disorders.
* Convulsion.
* Botox injection
* Fixed deformities of lower limbs and spine.
* Selective dorsal rhizotomy (SDR).
* Children with spasticity more than 1+ according to the modified Ashworth scale.
* Children with visual disorders such as squint myopia.
* children with auditory problems.
